00022    template <typename Data>
00023    class DPArray : public PArray<Data>
00024    {
00025 
00026    public:
00027 
00031       DPArray();
00032 
00040       DPArray(const DPArray<Data>& other);
00041    
00051       DPArray<Data>& operator=(const DPArray<Data>& other);
00052 
00059       virtual ~DPArray();
00060

00070 
00076       void append(Data& data);
00077 
00081       void clear();

00086       using PArray<Data>::capacity_;

00091    /*
00092    * Default constructor.
00093    */
00094    template <typename Data>
00095    inline DPArray<Data>::DPArray()
00096     : PArray<Data>()
00097    {}
00098 
00106    template <typename Data>
00107    DPArray<Data>::DPArray(const DPArray<Data>& other) 
00108     : PArray<Data>()
00109    {
00110       if (other.isAllocated()) {
00111 
00112          // Allocate array of Data* pointers
00113          ptrs_     = new Data*[other.capacity_];
00114          capacity_ = other.capacity_;
00115 
00116          // Copy pointers
00117          int i;
00118          for (i = 0; i < other.size_; ++i) {
00119             ptrs_[i] = other.ptrs_[i];
00120          }
00121          size_ = other.size_;
00122 
00123          // Nullify unused elements of ptrs_ array
00124          if (capacity_ > size_) {
00125             for (i = size_; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00126                ptrs_[i] = 0;
00127             }
00128          }
00129 
00130       }
00131    }
00132 
00133    /*
00134    * Assignment, element by element.
00135    */
00136    template <typename Data>
00137    DPArray<Data>& DPArray<Data>::operator=(const DPArray<Data>& other) 
00138    {
00139 
00140       // Check for self assignment
00141       if (this == &other) return *this;
00142 
00143       // Preconditions
00144       if (ptrs_ == 0) {
00145          UTIL_THROW("LHS DPArray in assignment is not allocated");
00146       }
00147       if (other.ptrs_ == 0) {
00148          UTIL_THROW("RHS DPArray in assignment is not allocated");
00149       }
00150       if (capacity_ < other.size_) {
00151          UTIL_THROW("LHS DPArray is too small");
00152       }
00153 
00154       // Copy pointers
00155       int i;
00156       for (i = 0; i < other.size_; ++i) {
00157          ptrs_[i] = other[i];
00158       }
00159       size_ = other.size_;
00160 
00161       // Nullify any unused elements
00162       if (capacity_ > size_) {
00163          for (i = size_; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00164             ptrs_[i] = 0;
00165          }
00166       }
00167 
00168       return *this;
00169    }
00170 
00171    // Destructor.
00172    template <typename Data>
00173    inline DPArray<Data>::~DPArray()
00174    {
00175       if (ptrs_ != 0) {
00176          delete [] ptrs_;
00177       }
00178    }
00179 
00180    /*
00181    * Allocate the underlying array of Data* pointers.
00182    */
00183    template <typename Data>
00184    void DPArray<Data>::allocate(int capacity) 
00185    {
00186 
00187       // Preconditions
00188       if (!(ptrs_ == 0)) {
00189          UTIL_THROW("Cannot re-allocate a DPArray");
00190       }
00191       if (capacity <= 0) {
00192          UTIL_THROW("Cannot allocate a DPArray with capacity <=0");
00193       }
00194 
00195       ptrs_     = new Data*[capacity];
00196       capacity_ = capacity;
00197 
00198    }
00199 
00200    /*
00201    * Append an element to the end of the PArray.
00202    */
00203    template <typename Data>
00204    void DPArray<Data>::append(Data& data) 
00205    {
00206       if (ptrs_ == 0) {
00207          UTIL_THROW("Error: Attempt to append to unallocated DPArray");
00208       }
00209       if (size_ == capacity_) {
00210          UTIL_THROW("Error: Attempt to append data to a full DPArray");
00211       }
00212       ptrs_[size_] = &data;
00213       ++size_;
00214    }
00215 
00216    /*
00217    * Reset to empty state.
00218    */
00219    template <typename Data>
00220    void DPArray<Data>::clear()
00221    {
00222       assert(ptrs_ != 0);
00223       size_ = 0;
00224    }
